inlineContent.text: is the common implementation of single-line text editing
that is shared between [class
], [class
[class
], and other widgets. In all of these,
is
used as the delegate for the [iface
] implementation.
A fairly large set of key bindings are supported by default. If the
entered text is longer than the allocation of the widget, the widget
will scroll so that the cursor position is visible.
When using an entry for passwords and other sensitive information,
it can be put into “password mode” using [method
In this mode, entered text is displayed using a “invisible” character.
By default, GTK picks the best invisible character that is available
in the current font, but it can be changed with
[method

]. There other alternatives for more specialized use
